Description: Smoking pipe made of two stems of pale wood, one tipped into the side, the other into the neck end, of a yellow gourd partly covered with an animal bladder.
Curator's comments: The old label is recorded: "Pipes en taleschiste en usage chez les negres du pays de Niam Niam".
Acquisition name: Donated by: Isma'il Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt
Acquisition notes: Exhibited in the Egyptian section of the Paris Exhibition of 1867 and subsequently given (as part of a larger collection) to the BM by the Viceroy of Egypt.
